commits.message:
EUCA-10762 - No space left on device error on CLC box due to eucanetd

Description: When eucanetd initializes itself it created files in /tmp used
             for ebtable, iptable and ipset rules. If not registered with the
             cloud eucanetd spins in this state creating thousands of empty
             files in /tmp. Also memory allocated to the handlers is not
             properly free'd before calling malloc again, causing a memory leak.
             This issue is not specific to running eucanetd on the CLC, it
             happens whenever eucanetd cannot load the cluster info in EDGE mode

Changes:
 - Added helper function to delete a file if it exists in /tmp.
 - Unlink associated temporary files when init failure occurs.
 - Skip ebt/ipt/ips/ipr initialization if eucanetd cannot determine it's
   cluster.
 - Call EUCA_FREE on objects that were allocated via malloc.

Testing:
 - Tested running eucanetd on a CLC. Verified that files
   are not created in /tmp when in this mode, using inotifywait.
 - Ran Valgrind on eucanetd in this mode for several minutes, verified that
   memory leak is no longer in the code path.
